content.raw:
You can double check the publishers and subscriber with:

On the publisher's machine:

Check the publisher:

```
#!c++

ldd publisher | grep protobuf
```
Check the protobuf version. 
Also, identify libignition-msgs0 in the output and run ldd there too to check the protobuf version linked.

E.g.:
```
#!c++

ldd /usr/lib/libignition-msgs0.so
```

On the subscriber side run the similar commands to verify that you're using the same protobuf version across all libraries.
content.html:
You can double check the publishers and subscriber with:

On the publisher's machine:

Check the publisher:

ldd publisher | grep protobuf

Check the protobuf version. Also, identify libignition-msgs0 in the output and run ldd there too to check the protobuf version linked.

E.g.:

ldd /usr/lib/libignition-msgs0.so

On the subscriber side run the similar commands to verify that you're using the same protobuf version across all libraries.
